title: Scale Input Values by a Factor
description:
TREND monitors the input X and time at the output Q to see if X increases
(Q = TRUE) or X decrease (Q = FALSE). If X does not change, Q remains at
its last value. If X increases, the output TU gets for one cycle to TRUE and
at the output D the result X - LAST_X is displayed. If X is less than LAST_X
so TD gets TRUE for one cycle and the output D is LAST_X - X passed.
LAST_X is an internal value of the module and is the value of X in the last
cycle.
name: SCALE_X4

input.name: IN1
input.description: First Boolean input to select between IN1_MIN and IN1_MAX.

input.name: IN2
input.description: Second Boolean input to select between IN2_MIN and IN2_MAX.

input.name: IN3
input.description: Third Boolean input to select between IN3_MIN and IN3_MAX.

input.name: IN4
input.description: Fourth Boolean input to select between IN4_MIN and IN4_MAX.

input.name: K
input.description: Scaling factor applied to the sum of inputs.

input.name: O
input.description: Offset added to the scaled sum.

input.name: IN1_MIN
input.description: Minimum value for IN1 when the corresponding input is true.

input.name: IN1_MAX
input.description: Maximum value for IN1 when the corresponding input is false.

input.name: IN2_MIN
input.description: Minimum value for IN2 when the corresponding input is true.

input.name: IN2_MAX
input.description: Maximum value for IN2 when the corresponding input is false.

input.name: IN3_MIN
input.description: Minimum value for IN3 when the corresponding input is true.

input.name: IN3_MAX
input.description: Maximum value for IN3 when the corresponding input is false.

input.name: IN4_MIN
input.description: Minimum value for IN4 when the corresponding input is true.

input.name: IN4_MAX
input.description: Maximum value for IN4 when the corresponding input is false.

output.name: SCALE_X4
output.description: The result of the scaled sum of the selected input values.

return_value.description: The final computed value after scaling the sum and adding the offset.
